meanings.definition: Not neat or organized in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: Her room was very untidy with clothes scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen was untidy with dirty dishes piled up in the sink.
meanings.sent3: The untidy pile of papers on his desk made it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as untidy as a jumbled puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The garden looked untidy, like a wild jungle of overgrown plants.

meanings.definition: Not kept clean or in order.
meanings.sent1: The bathroom was untidy with towels strewn on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The garage was untidy, filled with old boxes and tools scattered around.
meanings.sent3: His excuses for being untidy were always amusing but never convincing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt untidy, like a cluttered attic full of forgotten memories.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house looked untidy, as if time had forgotten to tidy it up.
